text:
Hi all :wave::skin-tone-3:
Does anyone know how can I take individual modules from  a free website theme in Marketplace and transfer it to my own theme?
Hi, I didn't reference the CSS file properly, so the changes I made to the CSS file have always been correct, but didn't show since the wrong CSS file was used to build the pdf doc
In my document I'm using a limited number of modules, and for all these I "said" page-break
<@U04VBE0DLSF> Hello World

I am trying to setup a webhook following the HubSpot Academy tutorial.

I have a Developer account set up with a Webhook subscription. The subscription is looking for a change to a Deal's "amount" property. I have the Target URL set as the endpoint of a Serverless function. The Deals are located in a Test Account created inside the Developer account.

In the terminal for my application I then run the following command to print a log from my serverless function:
_npx hs logs webhookdemo --follow_

However, when I make any changes to the Deal properties no changes get logged. Any idea why this is?
is the app installed under the connected apps tab in settings on the test account?
You'll want to use the `propertiesWithHistory` parameter to pull the historical values are certain properties.

Hey folks - we're working on getting this into our Code of Conduct, but *please* avoid using AI to generate code/answers to inquiries here if you haven't taken the time to verify it with a human eye before posting in here. Thanks!
Thanks to both of you. That was exactly what I was looking for. I somehow missed this in the API documentation

Hey I was approved to create Custom Objects via OAuth previously, and now I need to be able to create CRM cards on Custom Objects in customer portals as well. Is that something that I can get approved here?
So you can't create crm cards on custom objects through normal crm cards (marketplace apps)
The only way to do this currently is through developer projects
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/build-and-deploy-using-HubSpot-projects>
darn. Any idea what the plans are to allow that?
currently I don't think so
alright thanks

Hi HubSpot people,
Since there is no channel for HubDB, I’ll ask here…
Is there a way to disable some of the rich text editor features in HubDB?

I know I can <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields/rich-text-editor|edit the features> if I use a rich text field
Not currently, and HubDB talks (amongst others) are happening in <#C22PDRW72|data-driven-content>
I was afraid so :disappointed: Thanks for confirming Matias
I did read the blog templates can also contain drag n drop areas? How can I enable this?
